robotExplorartion

Class Simulation

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • robotExplorartion.Simulation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class Simulation
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    A Simulation Program to test Multi-Robot Exploration of a Map, it is thread safe
    Version:
    12/03/2014
    Author:
    Paul Monk
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Simulation.SimulationLoopThread
      A thread that loops through the simulation algorithm, 1 instance of this thread is required per robot

      Simulation(int threadNumberIn, boolean proprietaryAlgorithmIn, boolean twoRobotsIn, boolean coordinatedIn, int obstacleProbabilityIn)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Simulation

        public Simulation(int threadNumberIn,
          boolean proprietaryAlgorithmIn,
          boolean twoRobotsIn,
          boolean coordinatedIn,
          int obstacleProbabilityIn)
        Sets up and starts the Simulation, creating the map and positioning the robots then making the threads for each robot and running them
        Parameters:
        threadNumberIn - The number of this thread (to distinguish between different simulations running at the same time)
        proprietaryAlgorithmIn - which exploration algorithm should be used (true for proprietary, false for frontier)
        twoRobotsIn - True if 2 robots are running in the simulation, false if just 1 robot is running
        coordinatedIn - True if the robots will coordinate with each other in the simulation, false otherwise
        obstacleProbabilityIn - The chance of obstacles occurring (0-100%)

    • Method Detail

      • startSimulation

        public void startSimulation()
        Starts the simulation

        public void endSimulation(Robot robotIn,
                 int noOfSteps)
        Prints out the number of steps a robot has travelled, once it has finished exploring
        Parameters:
        robotIn - The robot that has finished exploring
        noOfSteps - The number of steps that robot took to explore

        public boolean previouslySearchedFront(Robot robotIn)
        Checks if the point in front of the robot has been searched previously
        Parameters:
        robotIn - The robot doing the exploration
        Returns:
        True if the point has been searched, false otherwise

      • obstacleInFront

        public boolean obstacleInFront(Robot robotIn)
        Checks if there is an obstacle present in front of the robot (simulates front ultrasonic sensor) and if there isn't an obstacle adds the points around the searched point to the list of frontier points
        Parameters:
        robotIn - The robot doing the exploration
        Returns:
        True if there is an obstacle, false otherwise

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        True if the point has been searched, false otherwise

        Parameters:
        robotIn - The robot doing the exploration
        Returns:
        True if there is an obstacle, false otherwise

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • nextStepToPoint

        public boolean nextStepToPoint(Robot robotIn,
                      java.awt.Point targetPointIn)
        Makes the robot take the next step towards a point (only used when the point is one square away from the robots current position). A step can be a move forwards, or a turn to the left/right of 90 degrees
        Parameters:
        robotIn - The robot doing the exploration
        targetPointIn - The point the robot needs to get to (can only be one square away from the robots current position)
        Returns:
        True if the point has been reached, false otherwise

      • getClosestUnexploredPoint

        public java.awt.Point getClosestUnexploredPoint(java.awt.Point currentPositionIn)
        Finds the closest unexplored (frontier) point to the robot
        Parameters:
        currentPositionIn - The robots current position
        Returns:
        The coordinates of the closest unexplored point

      • getDistanceToPoint

        public int getDistanceToPoint(java.awt.Point currentPointIn,
                     java.awt.Point targetPointIn)
        Estimates the distance between points using the Manhattan Block Heuristic
        Parameters:
        currentPointIn - The starting point
        targetPointIn - The target point
        Returns:
        The distance between the points

      • mapRouteToPoint

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Point> mapRouteToPoint(Robot robotIn,
                                                  java.awt.Point targetPointIn)
        Maps a route from the robots current position to the target point (using A* path finding algorithm)
        Parameters:
        robotIn - The robot doing the exploration
        targetPointIn - The target point
        Returns:
        An array of points which map the route to the target point (the route starts from the end of the array)

      • checkPoint

        public void checkPoint(Coordinate currentPointIn,
              java.awt.Point pointToCheckIn,
              java.awt.Point targetPointIn,
              int gScoreIn,
              DirectionEnum travelingDirectionIn,
              java.util.ArrayList<Coordinate> openCoordinatesIn,
              java.util.ArrayList<Coordinate> closedCoordinatesIn)
        Used by the A* path finding algorithm. This method checks a point to measure its heuristic scores, to decide if it is along the optimal path to the target point
        Parameters:
        currentPointIn - The parent point of the point to be searched
        pointToCheckIn - The point to be searched
        targetPointIn - The target point that the robot is heading to
        gScoreIn - The penalty score of travelling to this point (1 = a move forwards, 2 = a 90 degree turn and a move forward, 3 = two 90 degree turns and a move forwards)
        travelingDirectionIn - The direction the robot would be facing before travelling to this point
        openCoordinatesIn - The open coordinates list (from A* algorithm)
        closedCoordinatesIn - The closed coordinates list (from A* algorithm)
